TEXT.English: [TAB]When Alexander the Great died he left behind a power vacuum only to be filled by his generals, the Diadochi, who carved up his empire for themselves. One of these generals, Seleucus I, was proclaimed chiliach, or General of the Army, under Perdiccas.[NEWLINE][TAB]When Perdiccas was murdered in 321bc, which Seleucus had a hand in; he moved quickly to seize Babylon and the entirety of the Old Persian Empire. At the time of Seleucus own murder he was in control of the largest of the Successor kingdoms, with an empire that stretched from Asia Minor to India.[NEWLINE][TAB]To help control the towns and cities local magistrates worked from a building called the Seleukeion. These buildings managed everything from day to day running of the city. To trade along the vital trade routes east. Principles among those were the Persian Royal Road and the Silk Road.
